quotes.quote: There is more hunger for love and appreciation in this world than for bread.
To expect too much is to have a sentimental view of life and this is a softness that ends in bitterness.
Bitterness is like cancer. It eats upon the host. But anger is like fire. It burns it all clean.
Those who cannot work with their hearts achieve but a hollow, half-hearted success that breeds bitterness all around.
It is hardly possible to build anything if frustration, bitterness and a mood of helplessness prevail.
Bitterness and resentment only hurt one person, and it's not the person we're resenting - it's us.
It weren't too loo long before I seen something in me, had changed. A bitter seed was planted inside of me. And I just didn't feel so, accepting, anymore.
There is no disappointment so numbing...as someone no better than you achieving more.
Bitterness: anger that forgot where it came from.
It is okay of talking about the past, as long as there's no bitterness and anger. It only gives you a heart attack. It won't change the past either.
Things don't go wrong and break so you can become bitter and give up. They happen to break you down and build you up so you can be all that you were intended to be.
As I walked out the door toward the gate that would lead to my freedom, I knew if I didn't leave my bitterness and hatred behind, I'd still be in prison.
New beginnings are often disguised as painful endings.
Years of love have been forgot, In the hatred of a minute.
Forgiveness is a promise not a feeling. When you forgive other people, you are making a promise not to use their past sin against them.
He gave everything to everybody. Except to me.
Forgiveness is the key that unlocks the door of resentment and the handcuffs of hate. It is a power that breaks the chains of bitterness and the shackles of selfishness.
The bitterness of poor quality is remembered long after the sweetness of low price has faded from memory.
Bitterness imprisons life; love releases it
The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.
It's quite highly possible that I have peaked. I mean, I just can't imagine what else I could do beyond this. It's really a bittersweet kind of feeling.
I do not want to choose which one of you I must love or hate. Here, I am free to do neither. I want no part of your bitterness.
Never succumb to the temptation of bitterness.
Bitterness is like drinking poison and waiting for the other person to die
It is better to live in peace than in bitterness and strife.
Forgiveness is the key that unlocks the door of resentment and the handcuffs of hate. It is a power that breaks the chains of bitterness and the shackles of selfishness.
Bitterness and resentment only hurt one person, and it's not the person we're resenting-it's us.
Hurt leads to bitterness, bitterness to anger, travel too far that road and the way is lost.
